answers.answer: risks of complications for you are higher- gestational diabetes, high blood pressure, pre-eclampsia. risk for the baby is higher for birth defects (downs syndrowm etc.) your doc will most certainly watch you very carefully and recommend genetic testing for the baby to rule out birth defects.many women have successful healthy pregancys though, with proper prenatal care.i wish you the best of luck. :o)

Congratulations! You are so blessed. I recently saw an article about a 56 year old woman who gave birth to beautiful, healthy twins. You sound like you are in good health and take very good care of yourself. Just continue what you're doing and you and you baby/babies should be fine. I'm 41 and just went through an IVF and now they are telling me I'm losing the baby after 4 weeks. How were you so fortunate? Did you do IVF? Any advice would be good for our next try. Thank you and may God bless you with a healthy, full term pregnancy.

Hi, I am 46 and pregnant as well.  I've been doing a lot of reading.  There are some things to be concerned about, but when I had my son (at 25) I worried then as well.  I think that is just part of being a mom.  Good luck to you.   I am sure that everything will turn out fine.  Oh, and for cailey, I am sorry for what you are going through.  No, my pregnancy was not IVF.

question: I wonder what the risks are that im 46 and pregnant, im healthy,younger looking, go to gym twice aweek to do weights, walk daily, have a permanent relationship
title: 46 years and pregnant
